revised_title: A Comprehensive Review of Units and Standards
tldr: The author discusses the history and development of units and standards, focusing on the legal and conventional authorities that govern them. They explore the international organizations responsible for maintaining these standards, such as the Conference Generale des Poids et Mesures and the Comite International des Poids et Mesures. The author also examines the specific standards of length, mass, and electricity in Britain and their legal definitions, as well as the challenges and improvements in their implementation.
